reviewText: This movie is in line of British works ("Kidulthood [ NON-USA FORMAT, PAL, Reg. 2 Import - Great Britain ]", for instance) by producers concerned with reality of contemporary England, into which importing the in-advance- biologically-under-caste of supposedly equal "new Brits" is just a part of usual neo-colonial politics discriminating on non-Anglo-Saxon/Celtic basis, while mentoring a rest of the world on British "human rights achievements". Grey, bleak, opportunities-short reality of non-Britain-linked-biologically is being disclosed on example of Afro-migrants, where state-sponsored food and housing just boost a quest for a better life sponsored by drug-trafficking and illegal activities, murdering is among them, as other ways closed down for reasons mentioned above. And this situation ought to be extended to Australia, Canada and surely New Zealand, British Commonwealth's copycats of the UK, to a great extent.
